lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK sbd suriq ilv swDsMig qiRgun AqIq cIq Awsw mY inrws hY
lines.transliteration_english: Gurmukhi Sabad Surati Liv Saadhasangi , Trigoun Ateet Cheet Aasaa Mai Niraas Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: An obedient disciple of the True Guru lodges the Guru's word in his consciousness in the holy company of God-loving people. He protects his mind from the influence of maya (mammon) and remains free from the worldly options and conceptions.

lines.gurmukhi: nwm inhkwm Dwm shj suBwie irdY brqY brqmwn igAwn ko pRgws hY
lines.transliteration_english: Naam Nihakaam Dhaam Sahaj Soubhaai Ridai , Baratai Baratamaan Giaan Ko Pragaas Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Living and dealing with the world, the Naam of the Lord which is treasure-house of indifference to the worldly attractions gets lodged in his mind. Thus the divine light effulges in his heart.

lines.gurmukhi: sUKm sQl eyk Aau Anyk myk bHm ibbyk tyk bHm ibsvws hY
lines.transliteration_english: Sookham Sadal Ayk Au Anayk Mayka , Braham Bibayk Tayk Braham Bisavaas Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: The Supreme Lord who manifests in perceptible and subtle ways in everything of the world becomes his support when he contemplates on Him. He reposes his confidence in that Lord alone.

lines.gurmukhi: crn srin ilv Awpw Koie huie ryn siqgur sq gurmiq gur dws hY ]190]
lines.transliteration_english: Charan Sarani Liv Aapaa Khoi Hui Rayna , Satigur Sat Gurmati Gur Daas Hai ?190?

Shabad OS B.translation: By engrossing and attaching the mind in the refuge of the holy feet of the True Guru, one destroys his egocentricity and adopts humility. He lives in the service of holy men and becomes a true servant of the Guru by accepting the teachings of the True Gur
